description: IBM Key Protect helps you provision encrypted keys for apps across IBM Bluemix. As you manage the lifecycle of your keys, you can benefit from knowing that your keys are secured by cloud-based hardware security modules (HSMs) that protect against theft of information. You can use the Key Protect API to store, generate, and retrieve your secret key material. Secrets can be any type of data that you would like to protect with the service, for example RSA keys or certificates.

codeSnippets.template:
package main

import (
	"fmt"
	"net/http"
	"io/ioutil"
)

func main() {

	url := "https://api.ibm.com/api/v2/secrets?limit=0&offset=0"

	req, _ := http.NewRequest("GET", url, nil)

	req.Header.Add("bluemix-org", "string")
	req.Header.Add("correlation-id", "string")
	req.Header.Add("authorization", "string")
	req.Header.Add("bluemix-space", "string")
	req.Header.Add("content-type", "application/vnd.ibm.kms.secret+json")

	res, _ := http.DefaultClient.Do(req)

	defer res.Body.Close()
	body, _ := ioutil.ReadAll(res.Body)

	fmt.Println(res)
	fmt.Println(string(body))

}

import requests

url = "https://api.ibm.com/api/v2/secrets"

querystring = {"limit":"0","offset":"0"}

headers = {
    'bluemix-org': "string",
    'correlation-id': "string",
    'authorization': "string",
    'bluemix-space': "string",
    'content-type': "application/vnd.ibm.kms.secret+json"
    }

response = requests.request("GET", url, headers=headers, params=querystring)

print(response.text)

curl --request GET \
  --url 'https://api.ibm.com/api/v2/secrets?limit=0&offset=0' \
  --header 'authorization: string' \
  --header 'bluemix-org: string' \
  --header 'bluemix-space: string' \
  --header 'content-type: application/vnd.ibm.kms.secret+json' \
  --header 'correlation-id: string'

customHeaders.description: The v4 UUID used to correlate and track transactions.
customHeaders.name: Correlation-Id

endpoints.description:
Retrieves a collection of secrets that can be paged through.

Note: GET /secrets will not return a secret in the response body. You can retrieve the secret payload with a subsequent GET /secrets/{id} request.
endpoints.name: getSecrets

queryOrFormParameters.description: The maximum number of secrets to retrieve.
queryOrFormParameters.name: limit

queryOrFormParameters.description: The number of secrets to skip.
queryOrFormParameters.name: offset

childParameters.description: Up to 30 tags can be created. Tags can be between 2-30 characters, including spaces. Special characters not permitted are angled bracket, comma, colon, ampersand, and the vertical pipe character (|).
childParameters.name: tags

childParameters.description: The date the secret material was destroyed.  The date is specified by RFC3339.
childParameters.name: deletionDate

childParameters.description: Key state based on NIST SP 800-57
childParameters.name: state

childParameters.description: Provide the secret material or else leave blank so that the service generates one based on the specified algorithmType and algorithmMetadata fields.
childParameters.name: payload

childParameters.description: When an activationDate is included, the secret is created in the Pre-activation state before transitioning to the Activation state on the specified date. If no date is specified, the secret is activated immediately.  The date is specified by RFC3339.
childParameters.name: activationDate

childParameters.description: A code indicating the reason the secret is not in the activation state.  The code can be translated by using one of the administration REST APIs.
childParameters.name: nonactiveStateReason

childParameters.description: Specifies the MIME type that represents the secret resource.  Currently, only the default is supported.
childParameters.name: type

childParameters.description: The date is specified by RFC3339 and updated when any part of the secret metadata is modified.
childParameters.name: lastUpdateDate

childParameters.description: The secret identifier used to uniquely identify the resource.
childParameters.name: id

childParameters.description: Algorithm type to be used when generating the secret. Currently, AES is supported.
childParameters.name: algorithmType

childParameters.description: The unique identifier for the resource that created the secret
childParameters.name: createdBy

childParameters.description: Text field to provide a more detailed description of the secret. The maximum length is 240 characters.
childParameters.name: description

childParameters.description: A human-readable, non-unique alias to assign to your secret.
childParameters.name: name

responseCodes.message: The secret collection was successfully retrieved.

codeSnippets.template:
package main

import (
	"fmt"
	"net/http"
	"io/ioutil"
)

func main() {

	url := "https://api.ibm.com/api/v2/secrets"

	req, _ := http.NewRequest("HEAD", url, nil)

	req.Header.Add("bluemix-org", "string")
	req.Header.Add("authorization", "string")
	req.Header.Add("correlation-id", "string")
	req.Header.Add("bluemix-space", "string")
	req.Header.Add("accept", "application/json")
	req.Header.Add("content-type", "application/json")

	res, _ := http.DefaultClient.Do(req)

	defer res.Body.Close()
	body, _ := ioutil.ReadAll(res.Body)

	fmt.Println(res)
	fmt.Println(string(body))

}

import requests

url = "https://api.ibm.com/api/v2/secrets"

headers = {
    'bluemix-org': "string",
    'authorization': "string",
    'correlation-id': "string",
    'bluemix-space': "string",
    'accept': "application/json",
    'content-type': "application/json"
    }

response = requests.request("HEAD", url, headers=headers)

print(response.text)

curl --request HEAD \
  --url https://api.ibm.com/api/v2/secrets \
  --header 'accept: application/json' \
  --header 'authorization: string' \
  --header 'bluemix-org: string' \
  --header 'bluemix-space: string' \
  --header 'content-type: application/json' \
  --header 'correlation-id: string'

customHeaders.description: The v4 UUID used to correlate and track transactions.
customHeaders.name: Correlation-Id

endpoints.description: Returns the same HTTP headers as a GET request without returning the entity-body. This operation returns the number of secrets in your space in a header called Key-Total.
endpoints.name: getSecretCollectionMetadata

responseCodes.message: Your Bluemix access token is invalid or does not have the necessary permissions to access this resource.

responseBody.description: Your Bluemix access token is invalid or does not have the necessary permissions to access this resource.
responseBody.name: description

endpoints.summary: Retrieve metadata for a secret collection without fetching secrets

customHeaders.description: The v4 UUID used to correlate and track transactions.
customHeaders.name: Correlation-Id

customHeaders.description: Alters server behavior for POST or DELETE operations. A header with `return=minimal` causes the service to return only the secret identifier, or metadata. A header containing `return=representation` returns the secret payload and metadata.
customHeaders.name: Prefer

endpoints.description: Creates a new secret with specified secret material. Key Protect may generate a new secret payload on your behalf using the AlgorithmType and AlgorithmMetadata fields if the secret material is not initially provided. When successful, POST /secrets returns the new secret in the response body, unless the Prefer header is set to return=minimal, in which case the operation will not return the secret in the response.
endpoints.name: createSecret

codeSnippets.template:
package main

import (
	"fmt"
	"net/http"
	"io/ioutil"
)

func main() {

	url := "https://api.ibm.com/api/v2/secrets/{id_string}?include_resource=true"

	req, _ := http.NewRequest("DELETE", url, nil)

	req.Header.Add("bluemix-org", "string")
	req.Header.Add("authorization", "string")
	req.Header.Add("correlation-id", "string")
	req.Header.Add("bluemix-space", "string")
	req.Header.Add("accept", "application/json")
	req.Header.Add("content-type", "application/json")

	res, _ := http.DefaultClient.Do(req)

	defer res.Body.Close()
	body, _ := ioutil.ReadAll(res.Body)

	fmt.Println(res)
	fmt.Println(string(body))

}

import requests

url = "https://api.ibm.com/api/v2/secrets/{id_string}"

querystring = {"include_resource":"true"}

headers = {
    'bluemix-org': "string",
    'authorization': "string",
    'correlation-id': "string",
    'bluemix-space': "string",
    'accept': "application/json",
    'content-type': "application/json"
    }

response = requests.request("DELETE", url, headers=headers, params=querystring)

print(response.text)

curl --request DELETE \
  --url 'https://api.ibm.com/api/v2/secrets/{id_string}?include_resource=true' \
  --header 'accept: application/json' \
  --header 'authorization: string' \
  --header 'bluemix-org: string' \
  --header 'bluemix-space: string' \
  --header 'content-type: application/json' \
  --header 'correlation-id: string'
